titleInfo.subTitle: Brigadier Frank McCallum, Mrs. Sybilla McCallum, Benjamin and Lady Bromhead oral history interview, 1978

name.description: Brigadier Frank McCallum served in the Indian Army, being commissioned in 1919. During his career he served as commanding officer of the 10th, 60th, and 24th Indian Brigades; Brigadier General Staff Northern Command; and Director of Staff duties in Pakistan. Sybilla McCallum (n{acute}ee Barrow) was the daughter of General Sir George de Symons Barrow and Sybilla Way.; Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Benjamin Denis Gonville Bromhead was the son of Major Edward Gonville Bromhead and Emily May Hosking. He married Nancy Mary Lough, daughter of Thomas Seon Lough, on 6 August 1938. He fought in the Iraq Campaign in 1920 and in the Waziristan Campaign between 1922 and 1924, where he was wounded. He fought in the North-West Frontier in 1930, where he was mentioned in despatches. He gained the rank of Lieutenant-Colonel in the service of the Frontier Force Regiment, Indian Army. He succeeded to the title of 5th Baronet Bromhead, of Thurlby Hall, co. Lincoln on 31 July 1935. He fought in the Waziristan Campaign in 1937, where he was mentioned in despatches. He was Commandant of the Zhob Militia, Baluchistan between 1940 and 1943. He was invested as a Officer, Order of the British Empire (O.B.E.) in 1943. He was Political Agent for North Waziristan between February 1945 and April 1947.
